arts.ttl: Crystal Palace 1-1 Chelsea: Highlights, man of the match, stats from Premier League contest
arts.sum: Jean-Philippe Mateta cancels out an opener from Cole Palmer as Crystal Palace come from behind to draw 1-1 with Chelsea in the Premier League.

arts.ttl: Chelsea drop more points as Mateta earns draw for Palace
arts.sum: Jean-Philippe Mateta scored a late equaliser for Crystal Palace, as Chelsea were held to a 1-1 draw that extended their Premier League winless run to four matches. Enzo Maresca's side had plenty of chances to increase their lead and secure a first league victory since 15 December but Nicolas Jackson and Josh Acheampong, among others, were guilty of spurning good opportunities.

arts.ttl: Chelsea's missed chances vs. Palace show why they're not in title race
arts.sum: Chelsea boss Enzo Maresca claims his side isn't ready to challenge for the title, despite its place in the table. And after a 1-1 draw with Palace, he might be right.

arts.ttl: Oliver Glasner highlights half-time message key to Crystal Palace fightback against Chelsea
arts.sum: Crystal Palace boss is confident his team are good enough to beat the best sides in the Premier League

arts.ttl: Chelsea fans send clear Daniel Munoz message in Crystal Palace draw
arts.sum: Chelsea played out a 1-1 draw with Crystal Palace in Saturday’s Premier League encounter at Selhurst Park. The Blues are now winless in four games...

arts.ttl: Maresca believes 'Chelsea deserved to win' after draw at Palace
arts.sum: Chelsea boss Enzo Maresca says his side's 1-1 draw at Crystal Palace is "a shame" as the Blues "deserved to win".

arts.ttl: Glasner: "Everybody kept believing we could equalise"
arts.sum: Oliver Glasner said support from the stands kept his players believing an equaliser would come, after Crystal Palace earned a dramatic draw against Chelsea to kick-off 2025 with a well-earned point.

arts.ttl: The lowdown on Crystal Palace 1 Chelsea 1 - Eagles finally get positive SE25 result against west Londoners
arts.sum: Before the match, Palace boss Oliver Glasner commented on their ability to counter-press, especially in midfield, making it increasingly difficult for his team to gain a foothold or progress the ball from defence to attack. With 10 minutes remaining, Glasner’s side sprung to life a little – a cross-pitch switch found Munoz wide right – the resulting Mateta shot was deflected wide by Caicedo.
Crystal Palace manager Oliver Glasner says his side "deserved" a point in their 1-1 draw with Chelsea in the Premier League.

arts.ttl: Palace hit back as out-of-form Chelsea are pegged back at Selhurst Park
arts.sum: Cole Palmer had given Chelsea the lead.
